oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Chet Atkins Interview/Performance at Blair School of Music Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Chet Atkins being interviewed and performing at The Blair School Of Music.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two - (0:00) -- Chet Atkins begins performing an instrumental piece by Jerry Reed. (1:51) -- Chet Atkins begins playing part of a tune named "Scarecrow." (2:32) -- John Johns asks Chet Atkins when he first became interested in playing 'classical guitar', or nylon string guitar. (4:45) -- Chet Atkins discusses playing guitar for Segovia. The first five minutes of this tape can also be found at the end of side one. (8:30) -- John Johns asks Chet Atkins how many classical guitars he currently owns. (9:36) -- Chet Atkins discusses recording with Mark Knopfler. (11:00) -- John Johns tells a story about Chet Atkins. (12:28) -- Chet Atkins speaks about his recent album sales. (17:02) -- Chet Atkins mentions practicing behind stage at the Grand Ole Opry. (17:42) -- Chet Atkins speaks on his relationship and advice received from Byron Nelson (golfer). "You can get so from instructors and teachers and then you've got to dig it up yourself." - Chet Atkins. (19:22) -- John Johns asks Chet Atkins about how he first met Steve Sholes. (22:57) -- Chet Atkins discusses working with George Barnes. (23:17) -- "The chair would squeak and he would say, F#!" - Chet Atkins telling a joke about George Barnes. (23:35) -- Chet Atkins mentions learning and playing with George Barnes in a hotel room. (24:58) -- John Johns telling a story about interviewing Steve Sholes about who made the most money for RCA. (26:14) -- Chet Atkins playing a snippet of "Let It Be Me." (27:49) -- Chet Atkins speaks about Charley Pride. (31:22) -- Chet Atkins speaks about his first guitar methodology book through RCA. (33:08) -- Someone from the audience asks Chet Atkins about whether he listens to his own recordings. (34:20) -- Member of audience questions Chet Atkins about when he almost quit playing music in 1946. (38:39) -- Chet Atkins describes meeting and working with The Carter Sisters. (41:22) -- Member of audience asks about how Chet Atkins began working with Mark Knopfler.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Atkins, Chet;
